survey.title: Photo Survey
survey.description: This is a survey to test behavior of the photo prompt type.

prompt.promptText: In portrait, does this look correct before and after taking a photo?
In landscape, does this look correct before and after taking a photo?

message.messageText: The following tests cannot be verified until after the survey has been submitted. Therefore, do what each question asks and make a note of what you expect to see. Then, immediately after submitting the survey response, check the SD card to ensure that the images exist and conform to the test(s). Then, tell the phone to upload the survey. Finally, check that the images have been renamed/moved/stored correctly and that their content has not changed.

prompt.promptText: Take a photo and make sure its maximum resolution is 320 pixels.
Take a photo and make sure its maximum resolution is 640 pixels.
Take a photo and make sure its resolution is whatever is stated in the camera properties when taking the photo.

message.messageText: All tests appear to have passed.
One or more tests failed.

survey.title: Single Choice Survey
survey.description: This is a survey to test behavior of the single_choice prompt type.

prompt.promptText: In portrait, does this look correct?
In landscape, does this look correct?
Make sure that you much choose exactly one.
Make sure you can choose the correct choice.
Make sure the default is selected.
Make sure all of the prompts look correct and that the really long prompt is scrollable rather than taking up too much screen real estate.

property.label: This one should be much longer
This one is designed to be really long but not the longest

This one should be crazy long. You should be able to scroll if it is greater than four lines long in the list, which it really should be unless, of course, you are on a phone with a really big screen or on a tablet or something. That's why I keep rambling on. Sure, I could have just grabbed the "Lorem ipsum..." text, which is what everyone noramlly does, but that seemed too easy. This is much more interesting, and much more descriptive.

prompt.promptText: Make the right choice.
This prompt should be shown.
This prompt should NOT be shown.

message.messageText: All tests appear to have passed.

survey.title: Text Survey
survey.description: This is a survey to test behavior of the text prompt type.

prompt.promptText: In portrait, does this look correct?
In landscape, does this look correct?
Is the default text "Hello, world!"?
Do you have to type in at least 1 character?
Can you not type in more than 2 characters?
The min and max are both 0, but some text is always required. So, the only allowed response should be to skip this prompt.

prompt.promptText: In portrait, does this look correct before and after taking a video?

message.messageText: The following tests cannot be verified until after the survey has been submitted. Therefore, do what each question asks and make a note of what you expect to see. Then, immediately after submitting the survey response, check the SD card to ensure that the videos exist and conform to the test(s). Then, tell the phone to upload the survey. Finally, check that the videos have been renamed/moved/stored correctly and that their content has not changed.

prompt.promptText: Take a video and make sure its resolution is whatever is stated in the camera properties when taking the photo.

survey.title: Multi Choice Survey
survey.description: This is a survey to test behavior of the multi choice prompt type.
survey.submitText: Done with the multi choice survey

prompt.promptText: The Transverse Ranges are a group of mountain ranges of southern California, in the Pacific Coast Ranges physiographic region that runs along the Pacific coast from Alaska to Mexico in North America. The Transverse Ranges begin at the southern end of the California Coast Ranges and lie between Santa Barbara and San Diego counties. They derive the name Transverse Ranges due to their East-West orientation, making them transverse to the general North-South orientation of most of California's coastal mountains.
